title: Lake Tanganyika
summary: Lake Tanganyika is an African Great Lake.[4]  It is the second-oldest freshwater lake in the world, the second-largest by volume, and the second-deepest, in all cases after Lake Baikal in Siberia.[5][6] It is the world's longest freshwater lake.[5] The lake is shared between four countriesâ€”Tanzania, the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), Burundi, and Zambia, with Tanzania (46%) and DRC (40%) possessing the majority of the lake. It drains into the Congo River system and ultimately into the Atlantic Ocean.
